authors: Klasky, R., Curti, K., Townsend, H., Link, J., and  E. Wurst
background_text: The Multi-Species Statistical Catch-At-Age tool (MSCAA) allows the user to 1) run a single-species or multi-species catch-at-age model, and 2) visually inspect the resulting Abundance values interactively.  The application uses the 3rd party application ADMB with a model (i.e., .tpl and .pin files) supplied by Dr. Kiersten Curti from her 2012 PhD dissertation, Age-Structured Multispecies Model of the Georges Bank Fish Community.

software_badges.alt_text: A software badge showing that the repository is active.
A software badge showing the tool runs on Windows or Linux
